meanings.definition: The coldest season of the year, occurring between autumn and spring.
meanings.sent1: During winter, the snow falls softly from the sky.
meanings.sent2: I love to play in the snow during winter.
meanings.sent3: The winter weather makes me want to curl up with a warm blanket.
meanings.sent4: In the depths of winter, the world seems to sleep under a blanket of white.
meanings.sent5: The winter chill nips at my nose as I walk outside.

meanings.definition: To spend the winter in a particular place.
meanings.sent1: We plan to winter in Florida this year to escape the cold.
meanings.sent2: Many birds winter in warmer climates to avoid the harsh weather.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could winter in a cozy cabin in the mountains.
meanings.sent4: The wealthy often winter in luxurious resorts to enjoy the sun.
meanings.sent5: She decided to winter in the south to soak up the sunshine.

meanings.definition: A plant that flowers in winter.
meanings.sent1: The winter rose blooms beautifully in the cold season.
meanings.sent2: I planted some winter flowers to add color to the garden.
meanings.sent3: The little winter plant peeked out from under the snow, surprising us all.
meanings.sent4: The winter bloom stood out like a beacon of hope in the frosty garden.
meanings.sent5: The delicate winter blossom brought joy to the otherwise barren landscape.
